title: Part 1
content:
Part 1

"…TSK."

In the room, now devoid of Naoe, only Kamogawa, who had collapsed crying, and the cold meal remained.

"This is ridiculous!"

I voiced my unresolved feelings and shouted.

"He thinks I can still show off my skills? Don't make me laugh…"

Once you dropped out of the world of politics, everything ended.

Even if you tried making a comeback, you'd just be crushed.

"What will become of us now… Is everything over? Is it…"

Maybe I should've just punched him…?

No, punching Naoe there and indulging in momentary pleasure would've been meaningless.

I would've been arrested immediately, losing not only my status as a politician but everything else as well.

In the world of children's quarrels, it might've been enough to exhibit strength through fighting.

However, in this world, physical strength was just one of many weapons, and its effectiveness was weak.

Naoe, who looked like nothing more than an old man, had countless weapons.

"Don't think you can use me and get away with it, Naoe…"

I slammed my fist onto the tatami with all my might, venting my frustration.

In essence, I was just conveniently used and then discarded.

In the political world, once you fell, it was hopeless to get back up. The nail that stuck out would get hammered down, and that was the end.

"Is it over for me?"

Even if I put it into words, no real feeling would emerge.

How much bitterness do you think I've had to swallow to change this country and stand at its pinnacle? Do you think I haven't tasted humiliation, insult, and contempt?

That man was no longer of any use.

However, even if I were to strike out with something new now, I would just be crushed.

Naoe and I were two sides of the same coin. With him on the front, if I were to crush him, the other side, me, would automatically get crushed too. It was fair to say that until he retired—no—died, my path to a comeback was completely blocked.

So… if he dies, I might get another chance to make a move.

Should I contact Ooba and have him take care of Naoe…?

"Am I an idiot…?"

If I made such a request, Ooba would just cut me off.

It was clear which side would benefit him more.

"Kamogawa. Change your mindset. You have to start everything from scratch tomorrow."

"That's… the only option, but… What will you do, Ayanokouji-sensei? You wouldn't ignore an order from Naoe-sensei, would you?"

"…It's over for me either way. Stopping with my resistance now won't change how I'm treated. If so, I'll continue running the White Room even if I have to quit being a politician."

"Wait, please! I respect you, Ayanokouji-sensei! I believe that someday, you will surpass Naoe-sensei! Please don't talk about quitting!"

"This is the predetermined path. It's not something I can overturn with my will. However, you still have a chance. Your father's influence remains. With that being the case, continue fighting under Naoe as a politician."

"Ayanokouji-sensei…!"

"I'm not giving up on the White Room or politics, but I will abandon the latter for now."

That was the only way.

"No matter how much power Naoe has, he can't win against his lifespan. Eventually, he will die before us."

If it was going to take time, then so be it.

I'll let him enjoy his political life to the fullest while he's still around.

But when that ends, I—

I laughed and patted Kamogawa on the shoulder.

"It's not just Kijima. When I return to politics, I'll turn his son to ashes too."

"Haha… When you say it, Ayanokouji-sensei, it doesn't sound like a joke."

Wiping away his tears, Kamogawa spoke with a relaxed smile.
